page.title: 19MODERN LIFE IN THE AREA
page.content:
There is little commercial and social life in the area surveyed. Freeland has a village hall, a wooden single-storey building next to the playing field in the village centre, and here there is a playgroup for pre-school children, and some activities for old people. There is a light engineering factory to the south of Freeland and a large farm shop selling meat and dairy products. In the village is a convent and a private nursing home. The village shop is to the north of the village centre, just outside our area.
Tourism passes our area by, in favour of Woodstock to the north, Eynsham to the south and Witney to the west, but there is a small caravan site on the bank of the Evenlode SE of Church Hanborough at Goose Eye Farm GR 437121.
